page.title: 04TRANSPORT IN CHARD
page.content: The main road in Chard is the A30 which runs from East to West through the centre of town.It is called the High Road from about half way up Snowdon Hill to the top,the lower part is called Fore Street.The A358 runs from North to South through the town. We wanted to find out how busy these roads were,so we carried out a survey one week in June.As we expected we found that the intersection of the two main roads was the busiest place,with over 20 cars a minute.12 cars a minute went past the Guildhall on Fore Street.Most of the heavier lorries went to the industrial estate,such as the milk tankers and refrigerated lorries. Chard lost her railway in the Beeching cuts.
